comment.author: 14673419@N00
comment._content: translation: Serial "Merdeka" [Freedom]. After Dutch troops had to intervene due to the actions of the military and civil republican authorities at Palembang, immediate action was taken to help the hard hit population. The Red Cross was present at the spot and established policlinics to handle the medical emergency of the Indonesian and Chinese population

comment.author: 26315450@N06
comment._content: I reckon this is the original 1940's propagandistic text of the photo --if so, it really shows colonialism at its end. I personally find the combination of photo and text sickening, but also very educational --a strong image out of Dutch history.

comment.author: 10047629@N04
comment._content: Yeah, this whole series is pretty disgusting. Historical documents though, so definitely interesting to see. Thanks otkuda, I'm glad I'm not the only one who's upset at these photos.
